column1: Did you hear about the award winning scarecrow? he was out standing in his field.
column3: Standing can mean being upright or actively positioned, and also refers to the level of success (standing in ones field or profession).
column4: The soldier was standing guard at the entrance.
column5: He achieved a high standing in his profession due to his contributions.

column1: How do you sink a submarine full of blondes? knock on the door.
column3: Knock can refer to the act of hitting a surface to make a sound and can also mean to criticize or belittle something.
column4: I heard a knock at the door late at night.
column5: The critics decided to knock the poorly received movie.

column1: A cow went to war... but he didnt know what was at steak.
column3: Steak can refer to a cut of meat and can also suggest something significant is at risk.
column4: I ordered a steak for dinner at the restaurant.
column5: The companys reputation was at steak after the scandal.

column1: Why did michael jackson love beethovens 3rd symphony? it was done in a minor.
column3: Minor can refer to a key in music and also to something of lesser importance.
column4: The musician played a piece in a minor key.
column5: She was only a minor in the eyes of the law.
